intro: Tecticornia bibenda, commonly known as the slender glassworts, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, greenish flowers that are clustered in dense, spike-like inflorescences. Tecticornia bibenda is adapted to thrive in saline and waterlogged soils, making it a common species in coastal and estuarine environments. Its ability to store water in its leaves helps it survive in harsh, dry conditions.
